messages: cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:24): !help register
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:25): hey there
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:26): anybody online?
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (20:30): what you need?
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:31): just saying hello and trying to get into html5
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:31): http://episteme.arstechnica.com/eve/forums/a/tpc/f/6330927813/m/501005914831
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:31): (into the html5 community, I mean)
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (20:34): many just are still sleeping probably
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:34): Or taking the weekend off :)
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:35): I'm in a different time zone then most probably
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:35): (Israel, :) )
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:40): so what do you guys have established as far as the chicken/egg problem is concerned?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:40): "The W3C says that they won't touch it anymore. "XHTML is the future"." - they seem to be changing their minds now - see http://www.w3.org/html/wg/
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (20:43): cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9, look at the http://www.whatwg.org/ and the spec
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:43): what's the chicken/egg problem in this case?
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:43): http://waffle.wootest.net/2007/03/24/now-in-glorious-html5/
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:44): you decide to switch to html5, fine and dandy. obviously you won't get far today, even if it's adapted as a standard by the W3C you need browser support.
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:44): based on past history, it would probably take a loooong time
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:45): "I can't write a page in html5, browsers don't support it" "we can't support html5 in our browser, nobody is using it.. not worth it"
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:45): Well, the browsers are a big part of whatwg
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:45): cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9: well, there's buy-in from 3 of the top 4 browser vendors
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:46): exactly where I'm getting to
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:46): Microsoft isn't
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:46): cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9: it isn't unreasonable to expect them to actually implement this stuff
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:46): "in" is it?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:46): cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9: that's what the new HTML WG is for
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:46): to convince microsoft to support this?
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (20:46): cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9, browsesr support some parts already http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_layout_engines_%28WHATWG%29
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:47): even if they jump in at one point, probably what's going to happen is that all the other browsers will pick it up much quicker and more fully
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:47): cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9: to make it so that Microsoft's lawyers let the IE team speak with us
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (20:47): cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9, to make emulation for 100% suppor in IE some is already http://wiki.whatwg.org/wiki/Implementations_in_Web_browsers
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:48): and what about past versions of IE?
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:48): I realize html5 is backwards compatible in some places
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:48): but the new features arn't, if somebody was to make an application in the future that fully takes advantage of the spec and works well in other browsers..
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:48): what would happen when the page is rendered in IE6/7?
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:49): I guess my big idea here is so sort of escape trick to hide it from IE. kind of what was done with CSS. import and what not..
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (20:49): Depends on how you make the application
3e1c1074b5072fb0e507ed33291ed9b1 (20:49): one of the emulation project for IE http://sourceforge.net/projects/wf2/
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:52): webby: The new features are already designed so they'll fall back to sensible/acceptable behaviour in older browsers, without needing special IE-only hacks
cda41d8afd04dc92e7aa290f5383f8b9 (20:53): can you elaborate or point me in the right direction? I'm not sure how/what IE would do when it see's a new tag for example
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (20:54): <input type=number> falls back to <input type=text> for instance

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (20:55): I'm not sure what pointers are good [and I have to go now], but http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/?%3C%21DOCTYPE%20html%3E%0D%0A%3Ccanvas%3EFallback%20content%3C/canvas%3E (loaded in IE) demonstrates the kind of thing that happens
